title: The ggplot() Function
description: A short summary of the `ggplot()` function within the tidyverse library.
contents:
The ggplot() function:
ggplot() allows for the easy plotting of various types of graphic representations of data frames. These plots can start out as simple but can also be highly complex and customized. Below is an example of a simple point graph of data from the Palmer Penguins data set.



Note that it is critical to specify the type of plot desired after the ggplot() function. Below is an example of using the



stopped first draft here and will continue to discuss customization of graphs and other things with examples.
